  3254. The only thing I don't like is a little bit too strong smell, but it goes away in a little bit, not a big deal.
  3255. I have long hair and haven't run this this as quickly as I thought I would -- a little goes a long way.
  3256. I definitely have noticed a much smoother and less frizzir hair texture with the recommended combination.
  3257. I have thick coarse hair with lots of body that usually needs lots of product, work, and time to get it smooth & straight.
  3258. I have long, wavy hair that tends to frizz due to living in a VERY humid climate.
  3259. I bought this product based on Bradley Stafford's review of November 10, 2012 as well as other reviews that gave long, very explanatory reviews.
  3260. I have fine and thin hair and when I used this product it helps keep my hair bouncy..
  3261. I have pretty damaged hair due to years of neglect and tying it up wet...
  3262. I have fine, thin hair
  3263. good grief it makes my hair feel so soft and silky!
  3264. This made my daughter's curly hair more puffy and very dry looking, she was not pleased at all!!
  3265. I have naturally curly hair, that can sometimes be very dry.
  3266. has had little effect leaving my hair either too greasy or hardly straight.
  3267. *Updated Review Due to New Packaging
  3268. however it tends to get frizzy and sometimes quite damaged and coarse due to humidity where we live.
  3269. I don't use a flat iron, and do let my hair dry naturally.
  3270. When I used my flat iron there was no smoking or odd odor - and my hair straightened very well.

I really appreciate everyone's detailed help and I hope this helps someone as well. I put 2 drops in my hair while it's damp. I don't use a falt iron, but I do beat my hair up quite a bit. When it's dry the next day, I put 2 more drops on the end, tip my hair over/shake it out and it's like brand new hair again.

In past experience using foams or creams as thermal protection, I found that in order to get the job done, I had to use a lot of product...not with the Argan oil. Just a few drops works for me. It doesn't weigh down my hair or feel \\"cakey\\", and it gets me superb results. I find this to be an exceptional product at a very reasonable price. As a side note, once you apply it to your hair, DON'T wash your hands....just rub them together as you would when applying hand cream, and let the residual Argan oil sink in to the skin....only takes a minute or so, and you get the added benefit to your hands at no extra cost!

I would prefer a plastic bottle with a squeeze top so you can better control how much product comes out. I'm not sure why the product is in a glass bottle. I have been using about a nickel sized portion of this product in the palm of my hand and add it to the bottom 4 inches of my hair (I prefer to apply it to my hair dry but you can do it wet) and then style as usual. My hair feels softer and more manageable now - and if I decide to add curls, the curls last all day without adding hair spray. Because I don't need hair spray, I have been able to go a day in between without washing. It has a pleasant smell when you apply it, but I don't notice the smell after I'm done styling. With this product, the straightening iron runs smoothly down the hair and I don't feel like it's damaging anything. No more fly-aways at the bottom - just smooth, shiny, silky hair that flows. I am on my second bottle now - the first one lasted about 4 months. I will be buying more!

  402. First of all, I wanted to give everyone a quick breakdown of what's in the bottle. We're not dealing with 100% Argan Oil here, it is a combination treatment with Argan Oil in it.<br /><br />The first two listed ingredients are Dimethicone Crosspolyme (DC) and Cyclopentasiloxane (CYC). This combination of chemicals is often used in lotions, sunscreens, and the like -- anything that touts that it can &#34;remove wrinkles in minutes!&#34; likely has this set of chemicals in its ingredient list.<br /><br />It still maintains the traits of argan oil. Notably, it has the nutty/ rice-water like smell characteristic of argan oil and comes in a dark colored bottle that is needed to preserve argan oil's character. For me, there's nothing wrong with having argan oil listed as the third ingredient. After all, it is a very difficult to harvest the oil and DC and CYC both help to smooth hair and minimize breakage.<br /><br />This product definitely worked for me: my hair was not weighed down; it had a healthy sheen; my hair became more manageable (and took less time to style); and, my hair feels a bit fuller and moisturized. As the title notes, when used with a combination of other similar products, the results appeared in days (less than a week).
  403. Love it! great product! leaves hair feeling great, no greasy feeling. good size bottle will last a long time :)

The 100% Argan oil made my hair heavier, slightly greasy and did not eliminate frizz half as well as this product does.<br /><br />I LOVE this stuff!   443. my hair feels great after use. makes styling easy and helps to decrease the frizz in my SUPER FRIZZY hair!
  444. **Updated Review Due to New Packaging** Product is still good yet now is offered in a plastic bottle with NO shrink wrap. Photo shows previous glass bottle and it's former boxed/shrink wrapped container next to the new plastic version - new plastic bottle is shipped with no protection to prevent leakage. The new plastic, unprotected container is VERY POOR. Tampering, product loss, delays in receiving full product because of return - reduces rating. Correct the packaging issue at minimum by adding a shrink wrap on the top of the container to prevent opening & leakage.<br /><br />My most recent order arrived with less than 1/3 of the product inside the plastic bottle, the contents were not even inside the box so where did the product go?<br />____________________________________________________________________________________<br /><br />What I have: shoulder length, coarse, thick, wavy hair.<br /><br />My hair can be tough to manage and style. When sleek became the predominant style - I definitely needed help.<br /><br />This serum smells nice, is easy to use, and it works. I have used it for over 6 months now and there's not an issue with buildup nor does it make my sensitive skin break out or feel uncomfortable. When the weather is hot and humid, my hair is much more manageable. When it rains - I actually CAN have a good hair day! It does not weigh my hair down nor make it feel greasy or look &#34;product-laden.&#34; Try it. I think you will be pleasantly surprised what this conditioner does!<br /><br />Tips for use with Flat Iron: follow recommendation for applying product after shampoo/conditioner/towel dry; focus on ends; flat iron when hair is almost dry - still slightly damp - for super straight and sleek styles. You can use a thermal spray with this conditioner if you like without trouble, just use it sparingly as you flat iron and focus on ends. Try flat ironing thinner sections or layers of hair - use a clip to hold up top layers and release a layer at a time to flat iron if you have extra curly or wavy hair. When you get to the top layer and want to create a little more body - especially at crown - flat iron close to scalp with a slight twist under and out to ends of hair section. Everyone's hair is a bit different, experiment!<br /><br />**Consider the HSI flat iron if you are interested in real sleek styles - also does a very nice flip or curl-under.yer at a time to flat iron if you have extra curly or wavy hair. When you get to the top layer and want to create a little more body - especially at crown - flat iron close to scalp with a slight twist under and out to ends of hair section.   555. I have straight fine hair and when I wash it... it gets so poofy and gross. My ends are dry and break off so easy...<br />I purchased this because I got a free sample with a flat iron and liked it.<br /><br />After every time I wash my hair... once my hair is 90% dry I go through all of my hair and put this oil on my ends only. I cover an inch or maybe 2 inches of the bottom of my hair in this oil and by the second day my hair looks gorgeous.<br /><br />Yes this stuff is awesome to use as directed when flat ironing, but I have fine hair and usually when I put this stuff all over, I have to wash my hair the next day. If I just use the ends, and don't even flat iron... my hair look beautiful.. my ends look and FEEL very happy and soft. I have not been having as much breakage.<br /><br />If you have problems with split ends, get a trim and use this stuff religiously and you will not get no where near as much! I have the worst hair ever... and this stuff has literally made me so happy. I use moroccan oil too... but that usually is a little more greasy looking on my hair.<br /><br />Also, if you do put this on your ends like I do... be generous but not sloppy. do a pea size, rub it in your hands a very little bit and twist your ends or just rub it in. when your hands feel dry.. add more and move on to the untouched hair. keep doing that until you've covered your hair. Might look a little weird at first but when it dries it will be fine... and especially the second day!!! careful not to cover all of your hair or you might end up needing to wash it sooner than you'd like to.

  588. I have very fine, wavy shoulder length hair that tends towards frizziness. It's been colored and highlighted, and frankly, after this summer, was really unmanagable. The ends felt like straw, no matter how much I conditioned them, and my hair floated around my face. I wore a lot of buns. I read the reviews for this product and decided to try it. I washed my hair, conditioned, and then towel dried. I put a dime sized amount of oil, which is thicker than, say, olive oil, on the palm of my hand, gathered my hair into a pony, and massaged it in. I used the excess on my scalp. I then blew it dry. I normally just let my hair air dry, but I think you need the heat to help it absorb.<br /><br />Success! It is really soft now, full but not flyaway, and very shiny. It did not straighten my hair, just took out the frizz. The ends were still a little dry, so I applied a touch more with my fingertips where things felt crispy. It lasted for three days, which is how long I go between shampoos normally, so it wasn't adding oil to my scalp. I did end up using more oil every day just on the ends. If you have fine, damaged hair, give it a try....

  635. UPDATE: It is now the end of 2016 and I felt like I should update this review since it is so old. I still use this product. Yep, I still use it once a week to straighten or curl my hair with the iron. Either or, depends on mood. A couple things to note. It still works great during the summer for my curly hair. I have tried a lot of hair oils since this review. Some were given to me, some were in my Ipsy bag, and some I bought thinking that I might find something better. Wrong, oh so very wrong. WRONG. This is my holy grail hair product, the one I cannot, CANNOT live without. I have repurchased it only 2 times in the past two years. If you wash your hair more often you would use more. I am still in love with this stuff, and I think I always will be as long as they keep making it awesome.<br /><br />This is an amazing product. I have long, curly, frizzy, thick hair that I wear straight during the winter and curly during the summer. I do this because I have to air dry my curly hair for the curls to turn out okay, and it's to cold to do that during the winter. Anyways, for starters, I've used a lot of products before and this is hands down the best. When I straighten my hair I like to wash my hair once a week, on Saturday. I don't have greasy hair naturally, so I can easily go a week between washes when straightening. Plus, it's better for your hair. Many products do not allow this because they make my hair greasy, and to top it off, I wouldn't notice a deference in straightening time. If it takes me the same amount of time to straighten my hair with a product as it does without the product, and I have to wash my hair more with it, then it's no good. Also, products claiming to last a week with straight awesome hair with washes are pointless for me since I don't need to wash my hair but once a week without any product. That being said, after buying the straightener that had this little sample with it, I read up on all the reviews and thought I'd give it a try.<br /><br />First: it does not, in any way, make my hair feel greasy. Even after a week there is no greasy feeling from the product, and my sister-in-law has commented on how great my hair looks on the Saturday I plan on washing it.<br /><br />Second: the styling time has been cut in half. Literally blow drying and straightening my hair takes me about 30 minutes or less depending on how long after my shower I start doing my hair.<br /><br />Third: before this oil I would have to touch up my hair every morning. You know, get out a few kinks that showed up at night. Not anymore. Perfect hair all week, didn't have to restraighten once. I notice this only when I blow dry and straighten. If I put my hair in a braid and then straighten in the morning it isn't as good, but still better than without.<br /><br />Third: a little goes a long way. I've used this six times now, five weeks of awesome hair, and the oil isn't even under the neck of the bottle yet. I was so worried that I would be spending about $20 a month on this, which for some people is not a lot, but for us full-time moms and college students, I was worried. Considering how much use I've gotten and still have a practical full bottle, the price is pennies.<br /><br />Finally: it works great for leaving your hair natural. For those wondering how I got five weeks of awesome hair for six uses, well one time I decided to put it in my hair like I was going to blow dry and straighten, and my two year old started throwing up. Plans stop, mommy to the rescue. Well, an hour later I finally got to see myself in the mirror, and voila, non-frizzy, awesome, super soft curls. I could not believe it. The secret to good curls in curly hair is don't touch it while it's drying. The secret to awesome curls is use this oil while wet, then don't touch it while drying. Worth every penny and then some.it a try.<br /><br />First: it does not, in any way, make my hair feel greasy. Even after a week there is no greasy feeling from the product, and my sister-in-law has commented on how great my hair looks on the Saturday I plan on washing it.<br /><br />Second: the styling time has been cut in half. Literally blow drying and straightening my hair takes me about 30 minutes or less depending on how long after my shower I start doing my hair.<br /><br />Third: before this oil I would have to touch up my hair every morning. You know, get out a few kinks that showed up at night. Not anymore. Perfect hair all week, didn't have to restraighten once. I notice this only when I blow dry and straighten. If I put my hair in a braid and then straighten in the morning it isn't as good, but still better than without.<br /><br />Third: a little goes a long way. I've used this six times now, five weeks of awesome hair, and the oil isn't even under the neck of the bottle yet. I was so worried that I would be spending about $20 a month on this, which for some people is not a lot, but for us full-time moms and college students, I was worried. Considering how much use I've gotten and still have a practical full bottle, the price is pennies.<br /><br />Finally: it works great for leaving your hair natural. For those wondering how I got five weeks of awesome hair for six uses, well one time I decided to put it in my hair like I was going to blow dry and straighten, and my two year old started throwing up. Plans stop, mommy to the rescue. Well, an hour later I finally got to see myself in the mirror, and voila, non-frizzy, awesome, super soft curls. I could not believe it. The secret to good curls in curly hair is don't touch it while it's drying. The secret to awesome curls is use this oil while wet, then don't touch it while drying. Worth every penny and then some.
  636. I actually purchased this with the flat iron and had a bad experience.BUT, after the provider of this product saw my review they immediately shipped me a new flat iron because somehow the one I bought was defective. I'm super happy now with my flat iron and this oil is awesome too! Thank you!!!

  666. Sometimes I look at the most negative reviews first to see if even in the worst case scenario, I can still live with my purchase decision. On one of those negative reviews, I did confirm that \\"Benzyl Salicylate\\" is listed twice in the ingredients and although it may look intimidating, it's used as a fragrance additive or UV light absorber. Others have complained that it contains silicon oils such as \\"Dimethicone\\", which is commonly used as a moisturizer. After several months of moderate use, it did smooth out frizzy hair especially on the ends, leaves hair soft, and smells nice for the whole family.

  683. First off, I have short (3-4\\"), thick, curly brown hair that is wavy in spots, and decided a few days ago to try to style it with a hair straightening iron. I decided to give the sample a try and the results actually turned out pretty nicely even before I'd started using the iron. To me that was a surprise because I have trouble finding a hair gel that will keep my hair in place!<br /><br />The Argan oil smells sweet; I like my antiperspirant, shaving gel etc. odorless, and the Argan oil smelled pleasant however maybe a bit too intensely for my tastes. Compared to the Redken oil, the sample smelled 'darker' or 'heavier', for lack of a better descriptor. Then again, I didn't notice much of the perfume after I'd styled my hair with the iron.<br /><br />The Argan oil does make my hair shiny (which I love) and like I said, it works wonders for keeping my hair in place. It has been 2 days since I ironed my hair and it's still straight, even after I took a shower this morning. (I know going out into the rain instantly undoes my styling efforts whenever I use Heat Glide, but I *did* try to keep my hair dry in the shower.) It didn't feel dry or greasy before I stepped in the shower either, so the sample did a good job there!<br />I will have to see how the Redken oil compares in combination with my new hair iron, but I will consider getting a larger bottle of Argan in the future and I think I can safely recommend the Argan oil if you have difficult hair.

I like argan oil - I have a bottle of pure oil that I use for skin, and I could probably use it on my hair, but it was REALLY expensive. So, I ordered this.<br /><br />Very please with how the product performed, and consider it a great value considering small amount goes a long, long way - I'm talking less than dime size for my thick almost-shoulder length hair. And there-in lies the problem with the packaging. Good luck trying to get a small amount out of the bottle. There is no reducer included, so you have to try to slowly pour a small amount into your palm (this stuff is the consistence of olive oil). Given the tiny amount of product I need to get the job done, this is no easy feat. After 3 days of over-pouring, I started using an eye dropper to get a small amount without wasting, which works, but seriously....HSI --- put a pump on it!

I saw this on amazon and ordered along with the heat protector spray, and no lie, it worked WONDERS!!! Just a tiny amount through the hair not only eliminates frizziness, but makes hair incredibly soft, I can't stop twirling it! The extensions now match my natural hair perfectly! I use it every other day or less, it does not make hair greasy - in fact, I used to wash my hair twice a week, now I wash it once a week as it stays soft and straight for much longer. I also own HSI hair straightener, and this product combined with the straightener works fantastic.   800. It is absolutely unbelievable how good this Argan oil hair treatment is! I hate(d) flat ironing my hair because I thought my hair was too dry, limp, and weak to get soft, bouncy, moisturized results. Please believe the previous reviewers when they say &#34;A little goes a long way!&#34;...<br /><br />I have very low porosity hair (low porosity = hair that has a hard time absorbing and holding onto moisture, eg. dry!!!) And heat from blow-drying, flat-ironing, etc. (which I rarely use anymore), always drys my hair out even more. The reviews were so good on this product, I thought, though pricy, I'll give this a try...<br /><br />I blow-dried my hair w/a diffuser and I poured a little of the HSI Argan oil into a saucer (about the diameter of a votive candle). With each section I flat-ironed, I dipped my pointer finger in the oil, rubbed it between my first two fingers and my thumb, and applied it to the length of my hair. One pass of the flat iron at about 300-320 degrees was all each section took. One pass! It took about 4 &#34;pours&#34; into the saucer to do my whole head.<br /><br />The results? Uber soft, moisturized curls that (and this never happens), lasted all day! Confession: I couldn't stop touching it.<br /><br />Note:<br />For ladies who have a similar hair type and want to know how it may work for them; I'm African American and have shoulder length 4a-4b hair that's been textlaxed (hair with a relaxer used 1/2 the processing time with oil added to it, to only slightly release the curl pattern).<br /><br />This is now, and will continue to be, a permanent part of my hair care regimen.

  857. I have the HSI flat-iron, which I like. I used the HSI sample and ordered the full size. I can't remember why, but I also ordered the Arganesqe Morrocan Argan oil about the same time. I guess I wanted one to stay in my suitcase, one in my bathroom, and I could compare the two as well. I don't want to travel without the Arganesque now, so I'm ordering a second bottle of it, and I'm giving the HSI away. It's okay, but I can't believe that the Arganesque is so much better. I use it on damp hair, and there's almost no frizziness when I blow dry. Then I flat-iron, and it takes away even more. (I use a thermal spray after it's dry, before I flat-iron or use a Perfector.) I can even use some on dry hair for a final finish. With the HSI it looked halfway decent the first day, then better the second day, after I'd flat-ironed again. Hands down, the Arganesque oil made my hair softer, silkier feeling and shinier, with a lot less frizz. Couldn't believe there was that much difference in brands. I expected them to be the same.

  862. Love this stuff!!! smells great and leaves a very nice shine
  863. I bought this product based on Bradley Stafford's review of November 10, 2012 as well as other reviews that gave long, very explanatory reviews. Most of the reviews were 5 star ratings. What caught my eye with Bradley's review was his comment that he'd used silicone based leave-in conditioners prior to this product which left his hair dry (which silicone can do). Then he went on to rave about this Argon oil based product. I was pleased that he seemed to suggest that this product did not have silicone so after seeing all the 5 star ratings along with his I decided to order it. Once it arrived I immediately read the ingredients to see what the heck was in this 'miracle' oil. What a disappointment to find the very second ingredient was dimethicone (a silicone) Sheesh. I compared it to my Moraccan Oil Light MoroccanoilTreatment which does not protect my hair from heat at all and ends up drying my fine hair after using a flat iron. It too lists dimethicone as the second ingredient. In fact they are very close in their ingredient list. What a huge disappointment. As far as the smell, it's OK, not exceptional; and in fact, smells very very close to the scent of the Moroccan Oil treatment I mentioned Though disappointed, I tried it anyway. It's nothing special. I still had to put my other leave-in conditioner in along with it to be able to comb through my dry hair. I was careful to only used a few drops as the instructions say so I didn't have to wash my hair again (I've made that mistake before-haha). Please note as discovered by another reviewer of a beauty product: when numerous reviews are written on the same day or successive days consistently giving 5 star reviews containing little or no descriptive words (for instance: &#34;love it&#34; or &#34;great&#34; be suspicious folks. On average you normally get 1 or 2 reviews a month on any given product, not 4 or 6 in one day and successive days as well. This is not normal. Perhaps groups of people arepaid to write 5 stars reviews or something. I've noticed this happening with several beauty products recently. Why is this happening? I don't know, but for me, I will hereafter be very careful about basing my purchases on reviews like that. I now look for Vine reviews and reviews with 3 or less stars to see what people don't like about the product. I also look only at descriptive reviews, but I am now even a bit suspicious of overly long reviews from people who sound like ad men for the company selling the product. Beware and be smart before buying.

  958. I have really difficult hair: super fine (my stylist says it's &#34;like a baby's hair&#34;) and very prone to frizz. It's not quite ringlet curly, but is definitely more than just wavy; basically it's just a poofy blond mess and looks ridiculous if I don't straighten it. I've been dealing with it for close to 20 years now, and have tried MANY different products, but this one is without question the best so far. It just makes my hair so much more manageable and really helps to protect my hard-won straightness from humidity (which is a constant issue in my part of the world). I use quite a lot of it, and often for consecutive days without washing, and it doesn't weigh the hair down the way many products do. I also think that it does a lot to protect my hair from being damaged by all the straightening I do (my evidence for this is that my hair is now much longer than I have ever been able to have it before; usually it just gets so frayed and broken at the ends that I would have had to cut it months ago). Bottom line: I would recommend trying this product to anyone who wants straighter, shinier hair. It is worth every penny!

  1010. HSI Argan Oil is quite thick in formula, much thicker than pure argan oils I have tried. Its texture is thicker than cooking oil, so using too much could make your hair greasy. There is a pleasant hair product scent to it, because it has added fragrance, and it spreads out nicely in your hair, not creating clumps. I like this because it didn't make my hair greasy!<br /><br />I can't say anything about added shine, but as a leave-in treatment, it definitely did make my hair softer and easier to brush (I usually have slightly wavy, very tangly hair). I noticed this has lots of added ingredients so it is NOT all-natural. If you are looking for an all-natural pure argan oil, this product is not it.<br /><br />However, because it worked amazingly well—making my hair so soft and manageable—I use this every time I come out of the shower.<br /><br />My biggest complaint is the packaging. You're only supposed to use a few drops and smooth it through your wet hair, but there is no dropper or pump; it's just a screw-top bottle, which means you need to POUR the oil into your palm. Obviously if you pour an oil, you're not going to get a perfect 2-3 drops; you're going to get a little handful. Fortunately, I had some extra droppers from vitamin C serums laying around, and one of them fit perfectly on the mouth of this glass bottle. You are going to want to invest in a screw-on dropper bottle or pump cap if you want to use this product correctly and not waste it.<br /><br />FTC Disclosure: I received a complimentary sample of this hair oil from HSI Professionals in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions—positive or otherwise—and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own.

So I thought of giving this oil a try and ordered it.<br /><br /> This is how I use it: After a wash I let my hair air dry and when it is damp (not wet), I pour a little of it on my palm and rub my palms together to spread the oil. Then I run my hands in my hair (nowhere near the scalp as my scalp gets naturally greasy). And then let my hair air dry completely. Once it is dry, my hair feels so soft and no frizzes even if my straighten my hair.
